SEARCH
Package edu.jhu.en605681

Class Rates

java.lang.Object
edu.jhu.en605681.Rates
public class Rates extends Object
Rates is an object that provides a cost for a booked tour. There is a base rate and a premium rate that are used to calculate the cost of the tour. Weekdays use the base rate, weekends use the premium rate. The premium rate is automatically generated as 1.75x the base rate
Author:
Robert Evans and Rich Spiegel

    • setSeasonStart

      public void setSeasonStart(int month, int day)
      Set the starting day for the season. This is used to validate booking dates. Default is June 1st.
      Parameters:
      month - : integer (1-Jan, 12-Dec)
      day - : integer

    • setSeasonEnd

      public void setSeasonEnd(int month, int day)
      Set the ending day for the season. This is used to validate booking dates. Default is October 1st.
      Parameters:
      month - : integer (1-Jan, 12-Dec)
      day - : integer

    • isValidDates

      public boolean isValidDates()
      Method to test the start and end date against the selected hike and determine overall validity of hike booking.
      Returns:
      true if both dates are defined and valid, are not the same, begin date is before the end date.

    • numberHikersValid

      public boolean numberHikersValid()
      Method to test the number of hikers to see if it is valid. That means it's less than the maximum number of hikers allowed and more than one.
      Returns:
      true if between 1 and max number of hikers, false otherwise

    • isDurationValid

      public boolean isDurationValid()
      Method to test the duration value and check that it is valid for the selected hike.
      Returns:
      true if duration is valid for hike, false otherwise

    • getDetails

      public List<String> getDetails()
      If the BookingDays (start and end) are not valid, this method provides a String stating the booking is valid or details of the reason it's not valid. This is filled in once isValidDates() is called.
      Returns:
      java.util.List of java.lang.String message indicating the status of the input data validity

    • getNormalDays

      public int getNormalDays()
      Method to determine the number of weekdays in the reservation
      Returns:
      integer number of weekdays in the reservation

    • getPremiumDays

      public int getPremiumDays()
      Method to get the number of weekend days in the reservation
      Returns:
      integer number of weekend days in the reservation

    • setNumberHikers

      public void setNumberHikers(int h)
      Method to assign a number of hikers to Rates object. If not explicitly called the number of hikers will default to 1
      Parameters:
      h - : int value with the number of hikers

    • getDurations

      public int[] getDurations()
      Accessor for the valid durations of the selected hike
      Returns:
      int[] with the list of valid durations for identified HikeType enum

    • setDuration

      public void setDuration(int days)
      Modifier that sets the duration of the reservation. One day hikes means no overnight, a two day hike is two days, one night. Duration must be a valid duration for the specified Hike.
      Parameters:
      days - : int the duration of the hike
